Package emissary.grpc.pool

Class ConnectionFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.commons.pool2.BaseObject
      • org.apache.commons.pool2.BasePooledObjectFactory<io.grpc.ManagedChannel>
        • emissary.grpc.pool.ConnectionFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.commons.pool2.PooledObjectFactory<io.grpc.ManagedChannel>
    public class ConnectionFactory
extends org.apache.commons.pool2.BasePooledObjectFactory<io.grpc.ManagedChannel>
    Abstract base class for managing a pool of gRPC ManagedChannel connections.

    Configuration Keys:

    • GRPC_KEEP_ALIVE_MILLIS - Time to wait before sending a ping on idle, default=60000L
    • GRPC_KEEP_ALIVE_TIMEOUT_MILLIS - Timeout for receiving ping ACKs, default=30000L
    • GRPC_KEEP_ALIVE_WITHOUT_CALLS - Send pings even when no RPCs are active if true, default=false
    • GRPC_LOAD_BALANCING_POLICY - gRPC load balancing policy, default="round_robin"
    • GRPC_MAX_INBOUND_MESSAGE_BYTE_SIZE - Max inbound gRPC message size, default=4194304
    • GRPC_MAX_INBOUND_METADATA_BYTE_SIZE - Max inbound gRPC metadata size, default=8192
    • GRPC_POOL_BLOCK_EXHAUSTED - If true, threads block when pool is empty, otherwise throws an Exception, default=true
    • GRPC_POOL_ERODING_FACTOR - Optional shrink rate for idle connections, default=-1.0f
    • GRPC_POOL_MAX_BORROW_WAIT_MILLIS - Time to wait before failing a borrow attempt, default=10000L
    • GRPC_POOL_MAX_IDLE_CONNECTIONS - Maximum idle connections in the pool, default=8
    • GRPC_POOL_MAX_SIZE - Maximum total connections allowed, default=8
    • GRPC_POOL_MIN_IDLE_CONNECTIONS - Minimum idle connections in the pool, default=0
    • GRPC_POOL_RETRIEVAL_ORDER - Whether pool behaves LIFO or FIFO, default="LIFO"
    • GRPC_POOL_TEST_BEFORE_BORROW - If true, validates pooled connections before use with validateObject(PooledObject), default=true
    Source for default gRPC configurations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionFactory

        public ConnectionFactory​(String host,
                         int port,
                         Configurator configG,
                         Predicate<io.grpc.ManagedChannel> channelValidator,
                         Consumer<io.grpc.ManagedChannel> channelPassivator)
        Constructs a new gRPC connection factory using the provided host, port, and configuration. Initializes pool settings and gRPC channel properties from the given configuration source.

        See ConnectionFactory for supported configuration keys and defaults.

        Parameters:
        host - gRPC service hostname or DNS target
        port - gRPC service port
        configG - configuration provider for channel and pool parameters
        channelValidator - method to determine if channel can successfully communicate with its associated server
        channelPassivator - method that cleans up a channel after a gRPC call

    • Method Detail

      • acquireChannel

        public static io.grpc.ManagedChannel acquireChannel​(org.apache.commons.pool2.ObjectPool<io.grpc.ManagedChannel> pool)
        Borrows a ManagedChannel from the provided connection pool.
        Parameters:
        pool - the object pool to borrow from
        Returns:
        a managed gRPC channel
        Throws:
        PoolException - if the pool is exhausted or borrowing fails

      • invalidateChannel

        public static void invalidateChannel​(@Nullable
                                     io.grpc.ManagedChannel channel,
                                     org.apache.commons.pool2.ObjectPool<io.grpc.ManagedChannel> pool)
        Invalidates a ManagedChannel, removing it from the pool. Used when a channel is considered unhealthy or no longer usable.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel to invalidate
        pool - the pool the channel belongs to

      • returnChannel

        public static void returnChannel​(@Nullable
                                 io.grpc.ManagedChannel channel,
                                 org.apache.commons.pool2.ObjectPool<io.grpc.ManagedChannel> pool)
        Returns a previously acquired ManagedChannel to the connection pool. If the return fails, attempts to invalidate the channel to avoid pool corruption.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel to return
        pool - the pool to return the channel to

      • newConnectionPool

        public org.apache.commons.pool2.ObjectPool<io.grpc.ManagedChannel> newConnectionPool()
        Creates a new Apache Commons object pool for managing ManagedChannel instances. If the erosion factor is positive, wraps the pool with eroding behavior to gradually shrink idle connections.
        Returns:
        a new configured connection pool

      • create

        public io.grpc.ManagedChannel create()
        Creates a new ManagedChannel instance configured with the current factory settings. Called internally by the object pool during channel instantiation.
        Specified by:
        create in class org.apache.commons.pool2.BasePooledObjectFactory<io.grpc.ManagedChannel>
        Returns:
        a new gRPC channel

      • wrap

        public org.apache.commons.pool2.PooledObject<io.grpc.ManagedChannel> wrap​(io.grpc.ManagedChannel channel)
        Wraps a ManagedChannel for use with the object pool. Provides pooling metadata and lifecycle tracking.
        Specified by:
        wrap in class org.apache.commons.pool2.BasePooledObjectFactory<io.grpc.ManagedChannel>
        Parameters:
        channel - the gRPC channel to wrap
        Returns:
        a pooled object wrapper

      • passivateObject

        public void passivateObject​(org.apache.commons.pool2.PooledObject<io.grpc.ManagedChannel> pooledObject)
        Called when a ManagedChannel is returned to the pool. Since gRPC channels are designed to remain ready for reuse without needing to be reset or cleared, a no-op passivator is fine for most use cases. Custom behavior may become necessary if using a stub or channel wrapper that requires cleanup between uses.
        Specified by:
        passivateObject in interface org.apache.commons.pool2.PooledObjectFactory<io.grpc.ManagedChannel>
        Overrides:
        passivateObject in class org.apache.commons.pool2.BasePooledObjectFactory<io.grpc.ManagedChannel>
        Parameters:
        pooledObject - the pooled channel being passivated

      • validateObject

        public boolean validateObject​(org.apache.commons.pool2.PooledObject<io.grpc.ManagedChannel> pooledObject)
        Validates whether the ManagedChannel is healthy and can be reused. Called by the pool before returning a channel to a caller. Implementations should check connection state or channel health as needed. For example, you might verify that the channel is not shutdown or terminated.
        Specified by:
        validateObject in interface org.apache.commons.pool2.PooledObjectFactory<io.grpc.ManagedChannel>
        Overrides:
        validateObject in class org.apache.commons.pool2.BasePooledObjectFactory<io.grpc.ManagedChannel>
        Parameters:
        pooledObject - the pooled gRPC channel to validate
        Returns:
        true if the channel is valid and safe to reuse, false otherwise

      • destroyObject

        public void destroyObject​(org.apache.commons.pool2.PooledObject<io.grpc.ManagedChannel> pooledObject)
        Cleans up a pooled ManagedChannel when it is removed from the pool. Immediately shuts down the channel to release resources.
        Specified by:
        destroyObject in interface org.apache.commons.pool2.PooledObjectFactory<io.grpc.ManagedChannel>
        Overrides:
        destroyObject in class org.apache.commons.pool2.BasePooledObjectFactory<io.grpc.ManagedChannel>
        Parameters:
        pooledObject - the pooled gRPC channel to destroy
